snippet: A report issued last month by the Environmental Protection Agency suggests that the risks of large-scale mining in the intricate Alaskan ecosystem are too high.
abstract: Editorial expresses alarm about the possible construction of a giant gold-and-copper mine near the headwaters that feed Alaska's Bristol Bay, the heart of the regional $2.2 billion fishing industry; contends that environmental risks are too high, despite the potential creation of 1,000 permanent jobs.
lead_paragraph: A report issued last month by the Environmental Protection Agency suggests that the risks of large-scale mining in the intricate Alaskan ecosystem are too high.
